recipe_description: Classic Banana Bread: Sweet, moist and full of flavor.
recipe_steps: 1.Preheat oven to 180°C. Grease a deep-sided loaf tin 25 x 10 x 11 cm and set aside. 2.Place ripe bananas into mixing bowl and mash. 3. Add unsalted butter and caster sugar and mix until combined. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula. 4. Add eggs and mix. Add plain flour, baking powder, salt, baking soda, buttermilk and natural vanilla extract and combine. 5. Pour into prepared loaf tin and bake for 50-60 minutes 180°C or until a wooden skewer inserted into the centre of the bread comes out clean. 6. Allow to cool in tin for 30 minutes before turning out onto a wire rack. Serve warm or allow to cool completely before transferring into a sealable container until ready to use.

recipe_description: Delicious pulled pork with a fresh slaw inside a bun, what could be better
recipe_steps: 1. In a bowl, place chilli flakes, paprika, mustard powder, salt and pepper then mix together well. 2. Place bowl on mixing bowl lid and weigh in pork pieces. Remove bowl, rub spice mix over pork pieces then place pork in a separate dish and set aside. 3. Place water in pot. Place covered steamer into position then steam 20 min until pork is cooked through. Discard contents of pot. 4. Place cooked pork in mixing bowl tand shred. 5. Add barbecue sauce, Dijon mustard, cider vinegar and remaining 1 Tbsp water then mix.  Serve hot, in a brioche burger bun, with salad or coleslaw.

1. Preheat oven to 180°C. 2. Grate Cheddar and set aside. 3. Place eggs, cream, spring onions, parsley, salt and pepper in mixing bowl then mix. Add 60 g reserved grated Cheddar and mix well. 4. Heat oil in an oven-proof frying pan (approx. Ø 26 cm) over a medium-low heat. Add bacon and cook until crispy (approx. 5 minutes.) 5. Add spinach and cook until wilted (approx. 1 minute.) 6. Pour egg mixture into frying pan over bacon and spinach, then cook without stirring for approx. 5 minutes or until eggs are almost set. 7. Sprinkle remaining reserved Cheddar over frittata and place frying pan in oven for 15 minutes (180°C) until eggs are set. 8. Serve warm or cold.

recipe_description: Creamy and fresh, greek style, cucumber salad. Perfect for a summer snack!
recipe_steps: 1. Place diced cucumbers and salt into mixing bowl. 2. Transfer into simmering basket and leave to drain for approx. 10 minutes. Squeeze excess liquid out of cucumber then transfer cucumber into a bowl and set aside. Clean and dry mixing bowl. 3. Place garlic and dill or mint into mixing bowl and mix. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula. 4. Add all remaining ingredients, including reserved cucumber, and combine. 5. Serve immediately or refrigerate until ready to use.

recipe_description: Delicious desert big enough to share!
recipe_steps: 1. Preheat oven to 325°F. Grease a skillet (10 in.) and set aside. 2. Place butter and cream cheese into mixing bowl and mix. 3. Add eggs and mix. 4. Add brown sugar, sugar, vanilla, flour, baking soda, and salt and mix. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula. 5. Add chocolate chunks and mix. Scrape sides and bottom of mixing bowl with spatula and stir to further combine. 6. Transfer to prepared skillet, press to form an even surface and bake for 30-32 minutes (325°F). For a firmer cookie bake a further 5-10 minutes. Serve warm with vanilla ice cream.

recipe_description: Creamy rice with lobster, italian style!
recipe_steps: 1. Grate parmesan and set aside. 2. Chop the tarragon and set aside. 3. Chop shallots and garlic and mix with oil and 25 g butter. Transfer to a pot and sauté. 4. Add tomatoes and rice then, without measuring cup, cook 2 min. Scrape base of pot to loosen rice. 5. Add brandy and cook 2 min 6. Add boiling stock, reserved chopped tarragon, cayenne pepper, salt and pepper then cook 12 min. 7. Add lobster, stir in gently then cook 1 min 8. Add 50 g butter and reserved Parmesan then stir gently. Adjust seasoning if desired, then leave to stand for 2 minutes. Serve immediately garnished with chopped chives.

recipe_description: Sweet and tasty granola from scratch
recipe_steps: 1. Preheat oven to 160°C and line 2 large baking trays with baking paper. 2. Chop nuts. 3. Add oats, seeds, dried fruit and maple syrup and mix. 4. Divide between prepared trays and spread out evenly. 5. Bake for 15-20 minutes (160°C), stirring every 5 minutes. Set trays aside on a wire rack until granola is cool and crunchy. Store in an airtight container until needed.
